info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 7:03PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Moultrie, southern Piatt and northeastern Macon Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 702 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oreana, or near Decatur, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mount Zion and Long Creek around 710 PM CDT. Cerro Gordo around 715 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 72 between mile markers 143 and 164. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
